courses.name: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

cmCourseInfo.description: An opportunity for specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.

department.name: Department of Cell and Systems Biology

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students are responsible for finding their own supervisor. For more information, please go to: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb330y-project. Once a supervisor is confirmed, please submit a completed BCB330Y contract to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca. Contract forms and submission deadline can be found on the CSB website: https://csb.utoronto.ca/undergraduate-studies/resources/forms/.

courses.name: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

cmCourseInfo.description: An opportunity for advanced specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. BCB330Y1 is a recommended preparation for this course however students should not normally conduct their project in the same laboratory or continue their previous project. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.

department.name: Department of Cell and Systems Biology

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students are responsible for finding their own supervisor. For more information, please go to: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb430y-project. Once a supervisor is confirmed, please submit a completed BCB430Y contract to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca. Contract forms and submission deadline can be found on the CSB website: https://csb.utoronto.ca/undergraduate-studies/resources/forms/.
